title: Model output
description: Version 0.1. The schema describes the model output format for the IPM Decisions platform. See an example here: TODO

timeStart.description: The timestamp of the first result. Format: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssXXX", e.g. 2020-04-09T18:00:00+02:00
timeStart.title: Time start (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssXXX)

timeEnd.description: The timestamp of the last result. Format: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssXXX", e.g. 2020-04-09T18:00:00+02:00
timeEnd.title: Time end (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssXXX)

interval.description: The sampling frequency in seconds. E.g. 3600 = hourly values
interval.title: Sampling frequency (seconds)

resultParameters.description: Codes for the result parameters. They are unique to each model, and must be described in the DSS catalogue metadata property output->result_parameters).
resultParameters.title: Result parameter codes

message.description: Any message output from the model: Informations, warnings and error messages
message.title: Message

longitude.description: The longitude of the location. Decimal degrees (WGS84)
longitude.title: Longitude (WGS84)

latitude.description: The latitude of the location. Decimal degrees (WGS84)
latitude.title: Latitude (WGS84)

altitude.description: The altitude of the location. Measured in meters
altitude.title: Altitude (Meters)

data.description: The data. In rows, ordered chronologically. Columns ordered as given in resultParameters.
data.title: Result data per location

warningStatus.description: The basis for the 'Traffic light' status of the model prediction. It can have 5 different values: 0 = Status gives no meaning (e.g. outside of season or before biofix), 1 = Cannot give status due to error, e.g. missing data, 2 = No risk of infection, 3 = Medium risk of infection, 4 = High risk of infection. How to interpret these risks is unique to each model, and must be explained in the DSS catalogue metadata property output->warning_status_interpretation.
warningStatus.title: Warning status
